byline.contributor: Maggie Haberman and Kitty Bennett contributed reporting.

abstract: Protesters at Donald J Trump's campaign rallies have increased their vociferousness and aggressiveness, shouting slurs and expressing hostility in effort to shame Trump publicly even as they risk counterattacks from supporters; incident in which Trump supporter John McGraw was seen on video punching protester Rakeem Jones in his face discussed.
lead_paragraph: As Mr. Trump has unleashed the pent-up fury of economically displaced Americans, a much smaller but equally fervent protest movement has materialized.

headline.main: Riskiest Political Act of 2016? Protesting at Rallies for Donald Trump
headline.print_headline: Riskiest Political Act of 2016? Protesting at Rallies for Trump

snippet: As Mr. Trump has unleashed the pent-up fury of economically displaced Americans, a much smaller but equally fervent protest movement has materialized.
